alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 17 at 8:47PM AKST until December 18 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Northeast winds gusting 45 mph. Visibility of one half mile or less at times. Snow accumulation 1 inch. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel conditions will be difficult. Snow and blowing snow will cause areas of low visibility. Snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavier snow moving into the Point Hope area this evening will continue into Monday morning and cause visibility to drop to one half mile of less at times. Northeast winds gusting to 45 mph will decrease Monday morning and visibility will gradually improve then.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
